member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.CreateAnnotation.processNewAnnotation(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Collection,ESRI.ArcGIS.Geodatabase.IFeatureWorkspace)
member.summary: Collects all needed ORMAP data for the new annotation and copies it from the scratch workspace into the appropriate ORMAP annotation feature class
member.param: The collection of selected annotation feature classes
The scratch file geodatabase workspace
member.remarks: The EditorExtension On_Create event will overlay the anno with the map index and determine the MapNumber. This is incorrect, as the MapNumber is based on overlay of map index and line feature from which the anno is derived. Correct MapNumber is calculated during anno conversion and carried in TextString of Direction anno. the second newFeature.Store() method below assigns the correct MapNumber, and since its already fired (On_Create), it now trips the EditorExtension On_Update event, which won't perform the overlay and calculate the incorrect MapNumber.

member.summary: Implements the IConvertLabelsToAnnotation interface to create new bearing and distance annotation from the selected line(s).
member.param: The currently selected map.
The geo feature layer of the selected source line feature.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.CreateAnnotation.setLabelProperties(ESRI.ArcGIS.Carto.IAnnotateLayerPropertiesCollection2,ESRI.ArcGIS.Geodatabase.IFeatureClass,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets up the correct label placements based on type (Distance or Direction) and form settings.
member.param: The annotation properties collection source line feature.
The appropriate annotation feature class (based MapIndex).
The annotation class name (should be "34").
member.remarks: The map number must be embedded in the label now since annotation can be created in various map indices simultaneously. Once annotation is created, there is no way of knowing what its map number is, and this must be used later to populate the MapNumber field of the annotation feature class.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.CreateAnnotation.getLineOffset(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uses form property settings to determine how annotation should be placed relative to the source line from which it is created.
member.param: The font size of the associated annotation feature class.
The form property defining which element should be place "on top" (distance or direction).
member.returns: The distance used to offset the annotation pairs from the source line feature.
member.remarks: The fontsize is roughly calculated by MapScale / 240.

member.name: T:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.CreateAnnotation
member.summary: Allows creation of Distance and Direction annotation from Line Feature Classes that contain appropriately formatted Distance and Direction attributes.
member.remarks: Annotation Feature Classes must have definitions for an Annotation Class named "34" and a Symbol named "34" (with appropriately defined font size and type information). The tool will use these definitions for new annotation.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.DataMonitor.#ctor
member.summary: Private empty constructor to prevent instantiation.
member.remarks: This class follows the singleton pattern and thus has a private constructor and all shared members. Instances of types that define only shared members do not need to be created, so no constructor should be needed. However, many compilers will automatically add a public default constructor if no constructor is specified. To prevent this an empty private constructor is added.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.DataMonitor.SendExtinctToCancelledNumbersTable(ESRI.ArcGIS.Geodatabase.IFeature,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Captures the mapnumber and taxlot and records them in the CancelledNumbers table if they are extinct.
member.param: The feature to get the numbers from.
Whether the check is being called from within an OnChange event handler.

remarks.para: Taxlots will send their numbers to the CancelledNumbers table ONLY if they are "extinct" (unique in the map at the time of deletion/change).
If this check is being called from within an OnChange event handler, then it will use the feature's original values rather than its current values.
Features with null or non-numeric values will not be written to the table. This will effectively exclude roads, rails, water, and nontl polygons which have non-numeric Taxlot field values.

remarks.para: Member of System::IDisposable.
Dispose executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed.
If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.AnnotationUtilities.MoveAnnotationElements(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves annotation elements based on boolean settings
member.param: Boolean value to determine if annotation should be inverted (rotated)
Boolean value to determine if annotation should be transposed (flipped)
Boolean value to determine if annotation should be moved "up"
Boolean value to determine if annotation should be moved "down"
Boolean value to determine if annotation has standard space
Boolean value to determine if annotation has wide space

remarks.para: Annotation movement only works for annotation created and placed by the CreateAnnotation class. This class creates and places annotation based on a set of rules which comply with annotation spacing, fonts, and font sizes used in Polk County taxmaps.

Moving Distance and Bearing annotation is accomplished by describing mathematical relationships relating to a "virtual" line (the source line feature), which is not feature-linked to the annotation. Although this line may or may not be present or visible when annotation is displayed, the annotation pairs' only relationship to this line is mathematical.

Distance between the "upper" and "lower" annotation varies depending on their location relative to this line. Annotation on different sides of the line, both above the line, or both below the line have different distances between them (as placed by the IConvertLabelsToAnnotation ArcObjects interface implemented by this class). These distances are calculated relative to the centroid of the annotation's envelopes, and are dependent on font size. These distances also vary if the line is "standard" or "big" (wide). Annotation is placed with wide spacing if it will be located next to map index boundaries, taxcode lines, subdivision boundaries, etc.

Constants were calculated by checking envelope centroid distances for a number of annotation sets of different scales placed (by IConvertLablesToAnnotation) above, below, and on both sides of the line at 100, 200, and 400 scales. These constants were calculated from the formula:
remarks.code:
K = Distance / FontSize
Anno Location K ------------- ---- Both Sides 2.55 Both Above 1.75 Both Below 1.99

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.AnnotationUtilities.GetAnnoPlacement(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets enumeration value based on how annotation was originally placed relative to its source line
member.param: The font size of the associated annotation feature class
Scale constant for associated annotation feature class
member.returns: The AnnotationPlacement enumeration
member.remarks: Uses a "fuzzy" tolerance to determine if the distance between pairs of annotation are + or - 0.01 ft of where they should be (based on font size) if the CreateAnnotation tool placed the annotation. Annotation are placed relative to a line feature, but not feature linked to it. Therefore the tool has to know how much to move the annotation as if the line where there. It cannot do this correctly if the distance between the annotation pairs is too great.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.SpatialUtilities.GetValueViaOverlay(ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IGeometry,ESRI.ArcGIS.Geodatabase.IFeatureClass,System.String)
member.summary: Overlay the passed in feature with a feature class to get a value from the specified field.
member.param: The search geometry.
Overlaying feature class.
Name of field to return value for.

member.remarks: Gets the target feature with the largest area of intersection with the geometry and gets its value from the field, or, if tied (unikely but possible), then gets the best (lowest) value from the field, based on the order by field value.

Geometry to search in relation to spatialRelation.
Geometry relationship to searchGeometry.
SQL Where clause.
Read/Write state of the return cursor.

The returned cursor is updatable if IsUpdateable is True.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.MoveDown.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose of managed and unmanaged resources.
member.param: True or False.

remarks.para: Member of System::IDisposable.
Dispose executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed.
If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.Utilities.#ctor
member.summary: Private empty constructor to prevent instantiation.
member.remarks: This class follows the singleton pattern and thus has a private constructor and all shared members. Instances of types that define only shared members do not need to be created, so no constructor should be needed. However, many compilers will automatically add a public default constructor if no constructor is specified. To prevent this an empty private constructor is added.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.EditorExtension.Startup(System.Object@)
member.summary: Starts up the extension with the given initialization data.
member.param: A reference to the object with which this extension is registered (Editor).

remarks.para: Registered in this case with the ESRI Editor Extensions category.

Any extension that is registered with an application is automatically loaded and unloaded by the application; the end user does nothing to load or unload. For example, an extension that has been added to the ESRI Mx Extensions category will be started when ArcMap is started and will be shutdown when ArcMap is shutdown. In this case, the editor extension is loaded when the ArcMap Editor object is loaded, which occurs when ArcMap is started. So this startup event occurs when ArcMap is started (rather than when an edit session is started).

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditingAddIn.InvertAnnotation.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose of managed and unmanaged resources.
member.param: True or False.

remarks.para: Member of System::IDisposable.
Dispose executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed.
If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
